newsitem.title: GERMANY: German home shopping reaches six mln households.
newsitem.headline: German home shopping reaches six mln households.

text.p: Germany TV shopping broadcaster Home Order Television (H.O.T.) said on Wednesday it now reaches six million houselds nationwide.
Via the Astra 1D satellite alone, the network, started in October 1995, reaches 5.2 million households, or 52 percent of those with satellite hook-ups.
The remaining full-time subscribers in Munich, Nuremberg and Saxony-Anhalt receive the broadcast via cable providers, it said.
An additional seven million households in Frankfurt, Dresden and Leipzig receive one-hour chunks of H.O.T. via local cable stations.
Catalogue retailer Quelle Schickedanz AG owns 50 percent of H.O.T., media mogul Thomas Kirch 40 percent, and Georg Kofler, president of private broadcaster Pro Sieben 10 percent.
